intro: Sonchus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant has alternate, broadly ovate to lanceolate leaves that are smooth on both surfaces, with a slightly hairy margin. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Sonchus laevigatus is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
